Detailed Description

Indicates the position of a range, which is partly visible. The range is defined by a minimum value and a maximum value, the current position by a value. Additionaly it must be defined, how many values can be visible. The Position-Indicator can be aligned horizontal or vertical.

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

Orientation  orientation,

INT  max_value,
INT  visible_values_count = -1,
INT  value = -1,
BOOLEAN  auto_draw = TRUE
) 
 

Parameters:
control Pointer to the parent-Control.
orientation Orientation: Horizontal or Vertical.
min_value Minimum value (must be <= maximum value).
max_value Maximum value (must be >= minimum value).
visible_values_count Number of visible values (default: 1).
value Value (default: minimum value)
auto_draw TRUE, if the position-indicator should be drawn automatically in Control::OnPaint()

void PositionIndicator::SetMinValue (  INT  min_value  ) 
 

Parameters:
min_value Minimum value of the range (must be <= maximum value).

void PositionIndicator::SetOrientation (  Orientation  orientation  ) 
 

Sets the orientation (Horizontal or Vertical). The height is adjusted corresponding the settings in the view, when the orientation is Horizontal. The width is adjusted to the corresponding settings in the view, when the orientation is Vertical.

BOOLEAN PositionIndicator::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from DrawableObject.

void PositionIndicator::SetRange (  INT  min_value,
INT  max_value
) 
 

Parameters:
min_value Minimum value (must be <= maximum value).
max_value Maximum value (must be >= minimum value).

void PositionIndicator::SetValue (  INT  value  ) 
 

Sets the value. It is guaranteed by the method, that value is >= minimum value and <= maximum value.

Parameters:
value Value.

void PositionIndicator::SetVisibleValuesCount (  INT  visible_values_count  ) 
 

Sets the number of visible values. If e. g. GetValue() returns 5 and the number of visible values is 3, the values 5, 6 and 7 are indicated as visible. It is guaranteed by the method, that the visible_values_count is valid.
